body: Thanks for the report. Could you add a trace with `-v --trace-config all` for this situation?

I cannot reproduce it with the curl utility, it is reproduced with code example [upload-test.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/17201858/upload-test.txt). The example uses the curl multi interface.

I see. In that case, could you add the following line to the sample code, right after `curl_global_init()`?

```
curl_global_trace("all");
```

That will give more tracing at what is happening at the network level while talking to your server.

issue.title: ftp upload from stdin, fix 0-length last write

repository.name: curl
repository.description: A command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET, TFTP, WS and WSS. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features

issue.body:
When uploading FTP with unknown length, we write a last 0-length chunk with the EOS flag set. OpenSSL's SSL_write() errors on such a write. Skip writing 0-length data to TLS backends instead.

Add test in FTPS for such uploads to verify.

refs #15101

body: Thanks. I made #15102 with a test case and a fix for this.

Thank you. I also had a client complaining about this, so I applied your patch, rebuild curl and send to the client. Bug fixed.
Great work!
